attributes.action: make a minimum wage for people not in compulsary school age
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Did you know that there is no minimum wage for people of compulsary school age meaning that school children can be and are payed very little for jobs such as paper rounds? 

The current minimum wage:

£5.52 per hour for workers aged 22 years and older 
A development rate of £4.60 per hour for workers aged 18-21 inclusive 
£3.40 per hour for all workers under the age of 18, who are no longer of compulsory school age. 

This means that for all those children in school doing honest work can be exploited and payed next to nothing!
